intro: Parathesis calzadae, commonly known as the Calzada's parathesis, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical research due to its unique adaptations to its harsh habitat. However, it is critically endangered due to habitat loss and over-collection.
